thoughts.text: I need to specify the filename that I want to read. I think I should use the 'list_files' command to list the files in the current directory again, and then choose a file to read based on its name.
thoughts.reasoning: I received an error message because I didn't specify the filename that I wanted to read. I need to use the 'list_files' command to see the available files and then choose one to read.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the 'list_files' command to list the files in the current directory.
- Choose a file to read based on its name.
- Use the 'read_file' command to read the contents of the chosen file.
thoughts.criticism: I should be careful to choose a file that is likely to contain useful information, and I should make sure to save any useful information in a clear and organized manner.
thoughts.speak: I think I should use the 'list_files' command to see the available files in the directory, choose a file to read based on its name, and then use the 'read_file' command to read the contents of the chosen file.
